match.title: 4th ODI
match.statusText: Sri Lanka won by 5 wickets (with 8 balls remaining)

series.name: Sri Lanka tour of South Africa
series.longName: Sri Lanka tour of South Africa

image.caption: De Beers Diamond Oval - Kimberley
image.longCaption: De Beers Diamond Oval, Home of Griqualand West Cricket  - Kimberley

match.hoursInfo: 14.30 start, First Session 14.30-18.00, Interval 18.00-18.45, Second Session 18.45-22.15

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers b Perera 96 (76b 8x4 3x6 116m) SR: 126.31

dismissalComment.html: no century for de Villiers, ending a brilliant innings, a back of the hand slower ball from Perera deprives AB of a deserved hundred, AB moves across the stumps and wanted to help that down the leg side, he missed and that cannoned into middle stump

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith c Dilshan b Malinga 68 (69b 7x4 1x6 106m) SR: 98.55

dismissalComment.html: soft dismissal to end Smith's innings, the bat turns in his hand as he looks to work the ball to the leg side, a short of length delivery that ends up popping to short midwicket, runs for Smith but this was the perfect time to have got plenty more, Kirsten applauds Smith off the field

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: it has this time, Herath strikes first  ball, Petersen has thrown it away, he charges out first ball and looks to smack the ball over mid-on, skews it towards deep midwicket, Tharanga isn't all the way back, he has to still run in a touch, takes a good low catch to break a stand that has provided this new look South African batting a solid platform

South Africa losing their way towards the end, Sri Lanka back in it, the ball spins away from du Plessis as he looks to push the ball to the off side off the front foot, gets a thin edge through to the keeper

just as the game seemed to be drifting along, Pererea strikes, Duminy pokes at a ball outside off, looking to guide the ball to third man, it's too thin an edge, Sangakkara takes the catch, that was pretty innocuous from Thisara, gets him a wicket nonetheless

no century for de Villiers, ending a brilliant innings, a back of the hand slower ball from Perera deprives AB of a deserved hundred, AB moves across the stumps and wanted to help that down the leg side, he missed and that cannoned into middle stump

dismissalComment.html: it has this time, Herath strikes first  ball, Petersen has thrown it away, he charges out first ball and looks to smack the ball over mid-on, skews it towards deep midwicket, Tharanga isn't all the way back, he has to still run in a touch, takes a good low catch to break a stand that has provided this new look South African batting a solid platform

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith c Dilshan b Malinga 68 (69b 7x4 1x6 106m) SR: 98.55

dismissalComment.html: soft dismissal to end Smith's innings, the bat turns in his hand as he looks to work the ball to the leg side, a short of length delivery that ends up popping to short midwicket, runs for Smith but this was the perfect time to have got plenty more, Kirsten applauds Smith off the field

headshotImage.caption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Colin Ingram lbw b Kulasekara 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: Sri Lanka hitting back here, Colin Ingram is gone now, a low full toss on the boot, Ingram misses and that was going to hit, Ingram immediately walks up to AB and asks whether to take the review, there's only one per side each innings, AB tells him there's no point taking the review, a good call too, replays show that was going to hit the base of middle stump

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c Sangakkara b Perera 36 (47b 2x4 0x6 50m) SR: 76.59

dismissalComment.html: just as the game seemed to be drifting along, Pererea strikes, Duminy pokes at a ball outside off, looking to guide the ball to third man, it's too thin an edge, Sangakkara takes the catch, that was pretty innocuous from Thisara, gets him a wicket nonetheless

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers b Perera 96 (76b 8x4 3x6 116m) SR: 126.31

dismissalComment.html: no century for de Villiers, ending a brilliant innings, a back of the hand slower ball from Perera deprives AB of a deserved hundred, AB moves across the stumps and wanted to help that down the leg side, he missed and that cannoned into middle stump

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c Sangakkara b Herath 5 (12b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 41.66

dismissalComment.html: South Africa losing their way towards the end, Sri Lanka back in it, the ball spins away from du Plessis as he looks to push the ball to the off side off the front foot, gets a thin edge through to the keeper

dismissalText.commentary: Wayne Parnell run out (Tharanga) 21 (17b 0x4 1x6 28m) SR: 123.52

dismissalComment.html: a wicket! Peterson thinks he's AB de Villiers here, trying some outrageous strokes, jumps across the stumps and guides the ball towards short fine leg, sets off for a single, Sri Lanka get a direct hit at last, Parnell is caught short by Tharanga's throw

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Duminy b Tsotsobe 87 (87b 9x4 2x6 122m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: gone! neither captain gets a century, a shortish ball well outside off, chopped towards short cover by Dilshan, JP Duminy hangs on to a sharp catch, jumping to his left to pouch it, and Dilshan longest innings of the series comes to  an end, not the most dangerous of deliveries that

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera not out 69 (44b 3x4 5x6 75m) SR: 156.81

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: an early breakthrough for South Africa, Tharanga falls as he looks to slice the ball through the off side, some bounce for Tsotsobe, the top edge, and a simple catch for AB de Villiers, two half-centuries and two failures for Tharanga this series

gone! neither captain gets a century, a shortish ball well outside off, chopped towards short cover by Dilshan, JP Duminy hangs on to a sharp catch, jumping to his left to pouch it, and Dilshan longest innings of the series comes to  an end, not the most dangerous of deliveries that

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: no need to worry about that caught-and-bowled chance, Tsostsobe removes Chandimal, a fullish ball down the leg side, Chandimall had moved across, looked to flick that to the on side, off the pads and canons into the leg stump, a twists, and I'd think we have several more ahead of us

a soft dismissal once more, Thirimanne is gone an over before the Batting Powerplay, it was that slower offcutter once more, Thirimanne looks to whip it through the leg side, off the bottom of the bat and pops up to Duminy at short midwicket

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c de Villiers b Tsotsobe 6 (10b 1x4 0x6 13m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: an early breakthrough for South Africa, Tharanga falls as he looks to slice the ball through the off side, some bounce for Tsotsobe, the top edge, and a simple catch for AB de Villiers, two half-centuries and two failures for Tharanga this series

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Petersen b Peterson 32 (31b 2x4 1x6 56m) SR: 103.22

dismissalComment.html: a blinder to end Sangakkara's innings, great timing from Sanga to send the ball towards the deep midwicket boundary, even better from Alviro Petersen who jumps at exactly the right moment to be able to cling on to a high overhead chance, and he manages to balance himself perfectly, making sure he doesn't cross the rope after landing, hardly any celebration from Petersen though it was a sensational bit of fielding and the big wicket of Sangakkara

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne c Duminy b Philander 13 (15b 0x4 0x6 27m) SR: 86.66

dismissalComment.html: a soft dismissal once more, Thirimanne is gone an over before the Batting Powerplay, it was that slower offcutter once more, Thirimanne looks to whip it through the leg side, off the bottom of the bat and pops up to Duminy at short midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal b Tsotsobe 59 (81b 1x4 1x6 117m) SR: 72.83

dismissalComment.html: no need to worry about that caught-and-bowled chance, Tsostsobe removes Chandimal, a fullish ball down the leg side, Chandimall had moved across, looked to flick that to the on side, off the pads and canons into the leg stump, a twists, and I'd think we have several more ahead of us

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: what a grand way to seal the win, a powerful six, dead straight, clean as you like, that's out of the ground, and Sri Lanka have picked up their first win of the series

commentPostTextItems.html: There were steady improvements from Sri Lanka through the series, after the embarrassment of 43 all out, and they finally get a victory. Perera is the man of the moment - his six-hitting shouldn't obscure the big wickets he got earlier in the day - but there were superb hands from Tillakaratne Dilshan, finally finding form, and the youngster Dinesh Chandimal, who continues to impress at the international level. South Africa's fielding wasn't what it should have been towards the end - there was the Morkel drop, but there were plenty of fumbles in the field, and innumerable run-out chances were spurned.

Baundule sums it up: "Perera turned the match in Sri Lanka's favor with those crucial two wickets. And finished the job extremely well with the bat. It's a pity that he could not get a match before the series was lost."

AB de Villiers: "Very good game, we batted quite well up fornt, could have scored more in the last 10. They batted really well, chased down 300. I'll take responsibility for losing my wicket at a bad time, we could have got perhaps 330 if I stayed till the end. There are other areas for the team to work on. I wasn't too happy with our fielding, it wasn't the best outfield to field on either. Perera played extremely well, he made my job very difficult."

Tillakaratne Dilshan: "Fantastic effort. We tried to keep them to 250-260, but AB batted really well, at one stage I thought they could reach 350, but we came back well in the last 20 overs. We want to finish the series strongly, unfortunately previous game was rained out or we might have had a good decider. I was under pressure, and I am happy to come back to form."

The Man of the Match is Thisara Perera. "This is my first match in the series, I think I've done well. this is my normal batting, I like left-arm spinners. I want to bat well in the next game as well."
Abhishek Purohit is slaving over a match report, which will be updated in a few minutes. And check back in a bit for stories from Firdose Moonda, who has been watching this closely in Kimberley.
Thanks for all the mails today. See you lot on Sunday for the final ODI of the season. G''night!

commentTextItems.html: powerfully cut by Mathews, well stopped by Morkel at backward point, that spun away from him at the last moment but he managed to control it
eases it to long-on for a single

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

commentTextItems.html: another muscular hit from Perera, forces the ball towards the bowler, who gets a hand on it to field
a full ball heading for middle, thumped in to the ground and towards the bowler
full ball  between the batsman and leg stump, Perera looks to whip that to the leg side, he gets a thin edge that beats the keeper for four, only five away now
smashes it towards deep extra cover to get three this time, Sri Lanka are coasting to victory here
short of length ball outside off, slapped towards long-off for two

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentPreTextItems.html: Surprise, surprise. JP Duminy is on.

commentTextItems.html: on the pads, worked towards deep midwicket for a couple

commentPostTextItems.html: Technical trouble with Ten Cricket. Lost coverage here.

commentTextItems.html: a wide delivery is pushed to point for a single

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: a run-out chance, Tsotsobe makes a shoddy attempt to collect the throw from the deep, Mathews plays that towards deep square leg, and takes a single, Perera belatedly decides there a second, and might have been caught short if Tsotsobe had held the throw from the deep and broken the stumps

dropped, that was amateurish, certainly not expected from a South African side, Mathews looked to thrash that through the off side, it was a skier towards mid-on, Morkel settled nicely under it, somehow manages to drop that, was a sitter

dismissalComment.html: gone! neither captain gets a century, a shortish ball well outside off, chopped towards short cover by Dilshan, JP Duminy hangs on to a sharp catch, jumping to his left to pouch it, and Dilshan longest innings of the series comes to  an end, not the most dangerous of deliveries that

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Petersen b Peterson 32 (31b 2x4 1x6 56m) SR: 103.22

dismissalComment.html: a blinder to end Sangakkara's innings, great timing from Sanga to send the ball towards the deep midwicket boundary, even better from Alviro Petersen who jumps at exactly the right moment to be able to cling on to a high overhead chance, and he manages to balance himself perfectly, making sure he doesn't cross the rope after landing, hardly any celebration from Petersen though it was a sensational bit of fielding and the big wicket of Sangakkara

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal b Tsotsobe 59 (81b 1x4 1x6 117m) SR: 72.83

dismissalComment.html: no need to worry about that caught-and-bowled chance, Tsostsobe removes Chandimal, a fullish ball down the leg side, Chandimall had moved across, looked to flick that to the on side, off the pads and canons into the leg stump, a twists, and I'd think we have several more ahead of us

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne c Duminy b Philander 13 (15b 0x4 0x6 27m) SR: 86.66

dismissalComment.html: a soft dismissal once more, Thirimanne is gone an over before the Batting Powerplay, it was that slower offcutter once more, Thirimanne looks to whip it through the leg side, off the bottom of the bat and pops up to Duminy at short midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera not out 69 (44b 3x4 5x6 75m) SR: 156.81

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews not out 21 (25b 0x4 0x6 35m) SR: 84

Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 63 runs, 0 wicket)

GC Smith: 50 off 45 balls (6 x 4)
Powerplay 2: Overs 15.1 - 20.0 (Bowling side - 36 runs, 0 wicket)
Drinks: South Africa - 97/1 in 16.0 overs (GC Smith 54, AB de Villiers 5)
South Africa: 100 runs in 17.2 overs (104 balls), Extras 1
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 44 balls (GC Smith 22, AB de Villiers 25, Ex 5)
Powerplay 3: Overs 21.1 - 26.0 (Batting side - 41 runs, 2 wickets)
South Africa: 150 runs in 22.2 overs (134 balls), Extras 6
AB de Villiers: 50 off 31 balls (4 x 4, 3 x 6)
South Africa: 200 runs in 30.2 overs (182 balls), Extras 6
Drinks: South Africa - 206/3 in 32.0 overs (AB de Villiers 74, JP Duminy 20)
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 64 balls (AB de Villiers 21, JP Duminy 30, Ex 0)
South Africa: 250 runs in 40.4 overs (244 balls), Extras 7
Innings Break: South Africa - 299/7 in 50.0 overs (RJ Peterson 23, VD Philander 2)
Sri Lanka innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 68 runs, 1 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 50 runs in 7.1 overs (43 balls), Extras 1
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 39 balls (TM Dilshan 29, KC Sangakkara 19, Ex 2)
TM Dilshan: 50 off 50 balls (7 x 4, 2 x 6)
Powerplay 2: Overs 15.1 - 20.0 (Bowling side - 32 runs, 1 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 15.6 overs (96 balls), Extras 2
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 100/2 in 16.2 overs (TM Dilshan 60)
Over 21.6: Review by Sri Lanka (Batting), Umpire - BR Doctrove, Batsman - TM Dilshan (Upheld)
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 24.4 overs (148 balls), Extras 6
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 50 balls (TM Dilshan 18, LD Chandimal 28, Ex 4)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 188/3 in 33.0 overs (LD Chandimal 44, HDRL Thirimanne 11)
Powerplay 3: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 48 runs, 0 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 200 runs in 35.3 overs (213 balls), Extras 12
LD Chandimal: 50 off 67 balls (1 x 4, 1 x 6)

Sri Lanka: 250 runs in 41.6 overs (253 balls), Extras 16
NLTC Perera: 50 off 30 balls (2 x 4, 4 x 6)
6th Wicket: 50 runs in 41 balls (NLTC Perera 28, AD Mathews 20, Ex 2)
Sri Lanka: 300 runs in 48.4 overs (293 balls), Extras 17

milestones.description: This is the highest match aggregate (603) involving teams South Africa & Sri Lanka in ODIs

stories.title: All-round match-winner - six of Thisara Perera's best in Sri Lanka colours

stories.summary: Mahela Jayawardene will play no further part in the series after injuring his back but will watch carefully from the sidelines as Sri Lankan cricket enters yet another critical phase
